trans-unit.source: Represents the subject of a SAML security token.
<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security tokens specify their claims using SAML assertions, which can specify the subject of the security token.
The claims in a SAML assertion are represented by SAML statements.
The SAML specification defines a set of SAML statement types and one of them is a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement>.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement> asserts the principal that is the subject of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.
This principal is specified using a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property to `false`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, and the format the name is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
Format
Description
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.
A URI reference that represents the format that the name parameter is in.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat"></xref> property.
The domain in which the name parameter resides.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier"></xref> property.
The subject name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name"></xref> property.
name is `null` or is .

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> class using the specified name, the domain in which the name resides, the format the name is in, authentication protocols, additional authentication information, and a key identifier.
The format used to specify a name for the `name` parameter is extensible; the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
Format
Description
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.
The set of authentication protocols to specify for the `confirmations` parameter is extensible; however the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.
Protocol
Description

A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
A URI reference that represents the format that the name parameter is in.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat"></xref> property.
The domain in which the name parameter resides.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier"></xref> property.
The subject name.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name"></xref> property.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains URI references that identify the protocols to authenticate the subject.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods"></xref> property.
Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData"></xref> property.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Sets the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier"></xref> property.
name is `null` or is .
confirmations contains a `null` or member.
-or-
confirmations does not contain any members and name is `null` or is .
-or-
confirmations does not contain any members and confirmationData or securityKeyIdentifier are not `null`.
Gets a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.
Although the set of authentication protocols s extensible, the following table lists the protocols defined by the SAML specification.
Protocol
Description

A URI that specifies that the recipient of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token should use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.
A URI that specifies that additional information is not available for a recipient of a SAML security token to confirm that the SOAP message was sent by the SAML assertion's subject.

An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains a set of URI references that identify the protocols that should be used to authenticate the subject.
Gets or sets the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature that is identified by this SAML subject statement.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called, the cryptographic key specified in the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element of the digital signature for the SAML security token is used to set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A> property.
This cryptographic key identifies the subject.
The key identifier for the `<ds:KeyInfo>` element is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the cryptographic key that is used to verify the digital signature for a SAML security token.
Gets a set of claims using the properties of this class.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ExtractClaims%2A> method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims represented by this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> instance.
Gets a set of claims using the properties of this class and the specified SAML security token authenticator.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ExtractSubjectKeyClaimSet%28System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator%29> method to get a set of claims associated with the identity of a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken> security token.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SamlSecurityTokenAuthenticator"></xref> that authenticates the portion of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token that corresponds to the `<saml:Subject>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimSet"></xref> that contains the set of claims represented by this <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> instance.
samlAuthenticator is `null`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a key identifier that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the SAML security token.

The key included in the key identifier that is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property is decrypted and set to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A> property when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> method is called.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A> property corresponds to the `<ds:KeyInfo>` child element of a `<saml:SubjectConfirmation>` element of a SAML assertion.

A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> that provides access to a cryptographic key held by the subject of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Gets or sets the subject name of a SAML security token.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property is in and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property resides in.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The subject name of a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSecurityToken"></xref> security token.
Gets the claim type that is used to represent the subject name of a SAML security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameClaimType%2A> returns a claim type for <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property.
The claim type that is used to represent the subject name of a SAML security token (<xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.ClaimTypes.NameIdentifier"></xref>).
Gets or sets a URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property specifies the format that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property is in.
Although the format used to specify a name is extensible, the following table lists the formats defined by the SAML specification.
Format
Description
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified as an email address.
A URI that states the subject of a SAML assertion is specified using a Windows domain account.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A> property corresponds to the `Format` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
A URI reference that represents the format that the subject name of a SAML security token is in.
Gets or sets the domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property specifies the domain in which the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A> property resides in.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A> property corresponds to the `NameQualifier` attribute of the `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
The domain in which the subject name of a SAML security token resides in.
Reads the `<saml:Subject>` element from the specified XML reader.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ReadXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Name%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameFormat%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.NameQualifier%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.ConfirmationMethods%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.Crypto%2A>, <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.KeyIdentifier%2A>, and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> properties.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the `<saml:Subject>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in a SAML assertion.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is `null`.
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`.
reader refers to an XML element in which one of the following is true:
Contains an `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element without a value.
-or-
Contains an `<saml:ConfirmationMehtod>` element without a value.
-or-
Contains a `<saml:SubjectConfirmation>` element that does not have at least one `<saml:ConfirmationMethod>` child element.
-or-
Does not contain at least one `<saml:ConfirmationMethod>` or `<saml:NameIdentifier>` element.
reader refers to an XML element that contains a `` element that does not have a key that can be retrieved.
Gets or sets additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> property refers to an extensible piece of data that can be customized for a specific authentication protocol.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.SubjectConfirmationData%2A> property corresponds to the `<saml:SubjectConfirmationData>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) specification.
Additional authentication information that can be used by authentication protocols.
Writes the `<saml:Subject>` element into the specified XML serializer.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject.WriteXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%29> method to write the properties of the current <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject> instance into a `<saml:Subject>` element.
A <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the `<saml:Subject>` element.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
